intro: Glochidion heyneanum var. heyneanum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved glabrous hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical to ovate in shape. The plant produces small, showy flowers with five petals, typically in shades of pink or white. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
